results.title: Photographic memory: a portrait of Mervyn Bishop (A)
results.creator_credit: Warwick Thornton, Penny McDonald and Chili Films
results.brief_description: A documentary about the life and photography of Mervyn Bishop, one of Australia’s leading indigenous professional photographers who broke new ground during the 1960’s and 1970’s as a media photographer. Bishop’s extensive archive of photographs offer an invaluable document of aspects of Australian and Aboriginal life over the past 40 years.

results.title: Photographic design
results.brief_description: Host Brian Ratty explains and illustrates many tips about photographic design. He covers selecting the right tools, visualizing the best composition, and designing with light and colour.
results.description: Host Brian Ratty explains and illustrates many tips about photographic design. He covers selecting the right tools, visualizing the best composition, and designing with light and colour.

results.title: Photographers of Australia: Dupain, Sievers, Moore
results.creator_credit: Gregory Read, Wolfgang Knochell and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Since the arrival of the camera in Australia in the mid 19th Century, it has recorded the nation’s life. This is the story of some of the most enduring images of the Australian experience and the three men who made them - Max Dupain, Wolfgang Sievers and David Moore. Relive the history of Australia, from the 1930s to the present day through the lenses of these renowned photographers.

results.title: Photoelectric effect
results.creator_credit: Gene Kearney and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description: Presents qualitative demonstrations of photo-electric effect employing the sun and a carbon arc as sources. Also shows an experiment measuring the kinetic energy of the photoelectrons emitted from a potassium surface.
results.description: Presents qualitative demonstrations of photo-electric effect employing the sun and a carbon arc as sources. Also shows an experiment measuring the kinetic energy of the photoelectrons emitted from a potassium surface.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 25-26
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Mark Callan, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Phoenix”.
The final episodes of the television series “Phoenix”. Snow Job’: Chris is dealing with Sergio, her drug contact, and organises to buy 90% pure cocaine which indicates the drugs are probably off the boat. The Federal Police plant a camera on the boat to monitor activity but make mistakes in doing so. They send in two undercover cops to act as Customs agents but the crew realise there’s rat on board, resulting in dire consequences for Peter’s informant. Now that Peter does not have an informant on the ship, it is up to Chris to lead the squads to the drugs.Hit, Shit and Scatter’: Due to the continual mistakes made by the Major’s, a crisis meeting is called to discuss their future and they realise they will have to go after the crooks before the unit ceases to exist. Flannagan delivers drugs to Sergio in a hotel and they have enough evidence on him to charge him with intent, plus murder, thanks to the phone tap at the Food Plus store. Murdoch is brought in to tell the squad some devastating new about their future.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 23-24
results.creator_credit: Kate Woods, Julian McSwiney, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Phoenix”.
Shuffling Deck’: Now that the case has intensified from aggravated burglary to drug importation, the Federal Police are brought in and want to take over the investigation. There is no way the Majors will allow this to happen, so they decide to work together as a joint task force to try and catch the crooks. Ian and the forensics team has a breakthrough in the identity of Betty’s rapist with the discovery of very high lead levels in his blood.Under Siege’: Victor Flannagan is seen at a market talking to another character whom the Majors follow. He turns out to be Gary McKinnon and the Majors think he may be one of the burglars. They keep a trace on Gary’s flat and end up with enough evidence for a raid. It eventuates that Gary’s flat is rented out under the same name of the stolen Medicare card that was used to sell James Arthur’s Rolex to the pawn shop. The raid does not go well; firstly, they have trouble breaking the door down, then they lose Gary who escapes out a window, his terrified girlfriend also jumps out of a window and may never walk again. All the squad members are interviewed over the ensuing investigation into whether someone pushed her, which brings bad light on the Major crime Squad, again. Peter tracks Gary down to his ex-girlfriends house where he is taken hostage in a very violent situation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kate Woods, Julian McSwiney, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
